actions.committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

official_title: To provide a prize to the first manufacturer of highly-efficient mid-sized automobiles powered by gasoline.
subjects: Hybrid, electric, and advanced technology vehicles

summary.text: Excellence in Energy Efficiency Act of 2012 or the E Prize Act of 2012 - Requires the Secretary of Energy (DOE) to establish a program to award a $1 billion prize to the first automobile manufacturer incorporated in the United States to manufacture and sell in the United States 60,000 mid-sized sedans that operate on gasoline and can travel 100 miles per gallon.

titles.title: Excellence in Energy Efficiency Act of 2012
To provide a prize to the first manufacturer of highly-efficient mid-sized automobiles powered by gasoline.
